metadata.title: The role of membrane-promoted multi-point hydrophobic interactions between peptide catalysts and enantiomeric substrates in highly stereoselective hydrolyses of amino acid esters
metadata.journal: Journal of Molecular Catalysis A: Chemical

Japan Received 28 December 1995; accepted 22 April 1996 Abstract The 500 MHz NMR NOESY spectra of membrane-promoted multi-point hydrophobic interactions between peptide catalysts and enantiomeric amino acid esters were detected for clarifying the role of muti-point interactions between the reactants in the highly stereoselective hydrolysis reactions in a vesicular membrane. Keywords: NMR NOESY; Hydrophobic interaction; Supramolecular catalysis; Bilayer membrane; Stereoselectivity; Hydrolysis The membrane-assisted stereoselective hy- drolyses of N-acylated amino acid esters with the L-histidyl group-bearing di- or tri-peptide catalysts and dialkyl-chain surfactants have hitherto been investigated as a reaction model of enzymes, [l-5] and the hydrophobic interaction between the reactants in the membrane has been considered to give the substrate stereoselectiv- ity. However, there is no direct investigation of the hydrophobic interaction between the peptide catalysts and the enantiomeric substrates in the stereoselective hydrolysis in the membrane. This paper reports the role of membrane-promoted multi-point interactions (detected by means of H NMR NOESY spectra) between a peptide catalyst and enantiomeric substrates in the stere- oselective hydrolysis of amino-acid substrates by di- or tripeptide catalysts in a vesicular mem- brane (Scheme 1). For descriptions of the synthetic methods of the materials used in the present investigation see [l]. The stereoselective hydrolyses of 10.0 p,mol dm-p-nitrophenyl iV-acetyl (or decanoyl)-(r, or D)-phenylalanate (la or lb, respectively) by 0.1 mmol dmP3 peptide catalyst of Z-L-His (2). Z-L-Ala-L-His (3), Z-L-Leu-L-His (4a), Z-D- Leu-L-His (4b), Z-L-His-L-Leu (4c), Z-L-Leu- L-His-L-Leu (5a), Z-D-Leu-L-His-L-Leu Gb), or Z-L-Leu-r_-Leu-L-His (5) in the vesicular membrane of 1.0 mmol dm-3 N,N-bisdodecyl- N, N-dimethylammonium bromide (6) were car- 1381.1169/96/$15.00 Copyright 0 1996 Elsevier Science B.V. The catalytic rate constants k,,, were evaluated by the usual way [II, together with binding constants K,/N (N is an aggrega- tion number of 2162 [6] for the membrane of 6) and rate constants k, in the simplified reaction K. NOESY spectra of the interaction between 4a and L (or D)-7 in the membrane of 6. 1: Leus/acyl .5-8/CH,. 2: acyl 3/acyl 4/CH,. 3: acyl 2. 4: acyl 1. 5: PheP/Hisp/CH,-N. 6: Phe(OMe). 7: Leucx. 8. Hiscu. 9: Phea. 10: Z(CH,). 11: Phe(Ph)/HisG. 12: Z(Ph). 13: Hise. a: Phe(Ph)/Leu& b: Phe(Ph)/Leucu. c: Phe(Ph)/HiscY. process It can be seen from the kinetic param- eters listed in Table 1 that the dipeptide 4a or tripeptide Sa catalyst exhibited efficient stereos- electivity through the reaction (k,) step rather than through the substrate-binding (K,/N) pro- cess, while the efficiencies of 4b and 5b cata- lysts possessing D-Leu instead of L-Leu as an I The simplified reaction process is as follows: adjacent amino acid to the active L-His unit were very low. Neither the catalyst 2 possessing no adjacent hydrophobic amino acids nor the catalyst 3 having a less hydrophobic L-alanine instead of L-leucine were effective. Z-L-His-L- Leu (4~) and Z-L-Leu-L-Leu-L-His (5~1, both of which do not have the Z-L-Leu-L-His unit in their frameworks, were also ineffective. There- fore, the Z-L-Leu-L-His unit was found to be very important in the efficient peptide catalysts for the membrane-promoted stereoselective in- teraction with the enantiomeric substrates. The 500 MHz H NMR NOESY measure- ments of the sonicated membrane (of undeuter- ated 6; 20 mm01 dm- including the catalyst 4a (10 mmol dmp3) and the stable methyl N-decanoyl-(L or D)-phenylalanate substrate (7; 10 mmol dm- in D,O (pH 7.0 and p_ = 0.02) involving KC1 (20 mmol drne3) resulted in the two identical NOESY spectra for the enan- tiomeric L- and D-substrates at mixing time = 500 ms (Fig. 1). As Fig. 1 shows, the NOESY cross-peaks of the hydrophobic side-chain inter- action between the phenyl (Ph) ring in the side- chain (PhCH,) of 7 and the LeuG (or Leuo) proton or Hiscx proton in 4a are identical for ~-7 and ~-7. Such a mode of multi-point hy- drophobic interaction (Fig. 2) makes the dis- tance between the reacting positions of 4a and L (or D)-7 closer (or farther), respectively, so as to bring about the substrate stereospecificity of 4a through the difference in the hydrolysis rates between the enantiomeric substrates. The in- teramide hydrogen bond depicted in Fig. 2 might be present in the hydrophobic region of the membrane, but it was not clearly detected. In the case of less efficient catalyst 4b, the NOESY cross-peak of Phe(Ph)/Hiscu. disappeared with- out appreciable changes of other NOESY peaks; namely, the high substrate stereoselectivity of 4b is not expected without approximation of the His imidazolyl group toward the reacting posi- tion of the L- (or D)-substrate. The inefficient catalyst 2 also did not show the NOESY cross- peak of Phe(Ph)/Hisa under the same condi- tions of the NOESY measurement. L4 K.
